item.title: Top comment on this video is @Eli Wehbe and my next challenge. Vote. 2,900+ votes: "Run 100 miles handcuffed together." So we did. Every 10 miles: @Ketone-IQ Every step: coordinated chaos Every bathroom break: awkward But the fuel? Solid. Clean energy.
item.description: Top comment on this video is @Eli Wehbe and my next challenge. Vote. 2,900+ votes: "Run 100 miles handcuffed together." So we did. Every 10 miles: @Ketone-IQ Every step: coordinated chaos Every bathroom break: awkward But the fuel? Solid. Clean energy.

item.title: If you know a good therapist in the Redlands area who specializes in first responders or PTSD, please drop their name in the comments or DM me. I'm also open to hearing about EMDR or other treatments that have actually worked for you. Behind every "do har

item.title: Quick update on the process (and why it's so hard). First, thank you for all the therapist recommendations. I'm following up on them. This is a worker's compensation case. In California, PTSD is a presumptive condition for firefighters, police, and parame

item.title: Redlands Burrito League: Final Results One month. One segment around Oscar's Mexican Restaurant. 34,260 total efforts by the Redlands running community. The competition was incredible. Women's Division: Santa Barajas - 1,327 laps Elise Thomas - 1,247 laps

item.title: Social media loves highlights. Finish lines. Buckles. Smiles. But that's not the whole story. If we're going to break the stigma around mental health, we have to talk about the hard parts too. The struggles behind the scenes. The days when showing up feel

item.title: I have to read the comments because so many of you have provided me with amazing advice, positivity, and help. And I hope others that are struggling read those comments too, because it can help them too. Love this community Smile, or you're doing it wron

item.title: Holding my book for the first time. ‚ù§Ô∏è This doesn't fix what I'm going through. But it definitely made me smile. I've been staring at this book on a computer for months. Cover art. Font choices. Formatting. All digital. All abstract. Now it's real. Tangib

item.title: Hope this made you laugh. It was pouring rain and I had to climb a 10,000' peak after this video. Cody and I went through some pretty intense conditions. Freezing cold rain and strong wind made for a rough night. But in the end. We were successful. Smile
item.description: Hope this made you laugh. It was pouring rain and I had to climb a 10,000' peak after this video. Cody and I went through some pretty intense conditions. Freezing cold rain and strong wind made for a rough night. But in the end. We were successful. Smile

item.title: Another year around the sun. 48 today. Still grinding. Still making changes. Still trying to get better every day. This year had incredible highs and brutal lows. Finished races. Wrote a book. Struggled with PTSD. Set new goals. DNF'd. Celebrated wins. As

item.title: Pulled off the win although I had to really work for it. 100 miles/161 km does not come easily. Especially when the race starts at 6pm. Born to Run 100 miler was an incredible experience and I will be back. #runtok #ultramarathon #ultrarunner #borntorun
